newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Central Bank lowers mini-band on real.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Central Bank lowers mini-band on real.

text.p: Brazil's Central Bank lowered its mini-band on the real currency by buying dollars at 1.0645 and selling at 1.0695 reais per dollar in the commercial foreign exchange market, dealers said.
The previous mini-band was set on April 30 at between 1.0635 and 1.0685 reais per dollar. Today's auction was the first time this month the bank has nudged the mini-band lower.
Today's result of the auction represents a 0.09 percent decline from the previous mini-band and is in line with market expectations.
In the last few months, the Central Bank has lowered the mini-band between 0.57 percent and 0.63 percent each month.
